newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Canberra provides A$2.6 mln aid for Zaire.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Canberra provides A$2.6 mln aid for Zaire.

text.p: The Australian government said on Thursday it would provide A$2.6 million in emergency aid for the humanitarian crisis in Zaire.
Foreign Affairs Minister Alexander Downer said the money would help provide personnel to supervise the distribution of supplies, medical attention and coordinate relief efforts.
"But the urgent humanitarian need at this stage is not for food and other supplies, rather it is for logistical support, mainly experienced personnel," Downer said in a statement.
The government would allocate A$2.3 million to non-government emergency aid organisations for food, health care, water and shelter, he said.
It would fund A$100,000 for the United Nation's information network to help collect and distribute reports on the crisis and A$200,000 for the world food programme for communication equipment.
Several hundred thousand refugees have fled the conflict between Zairean Tutsi rebels and the army, retreating into neighbouring countries.
Many were involved in the slaughter carried out by then-Rwandan army and militia groups in 1994.
In 1994 millions of Hutu refugees flooded into eastern Zaire from Rwanda following the victory of a Tutsi-led rebel movement, ending the genocide of nearly 800,000 people.
